description: Borrowed from Latin supercilium (“eyebrow; brow, ridge; pride, arrogance”).

definitionGroups.group: (anatomy, rare) The eyebrow (arch of hair above each eye).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The overhanging margin of a bony cavity (as of the acetabulum).
(zoology) A superciliary marking or structure, especially in a bird.

definitionGroups.group: (architecture, classical) The narrow fillet above the cymatium of a cornice.

entries.meaning: A fillet above and below the scotia of an Attic base.
The lintel or transverse part of a door frame.
(rare, humorous) Superciliousness, haughtiness; an instance of this, a supercilious demeanor.
